commit_message:
Storwize: check flashcopy_rate before mkfcmap

Configure flashcopy_rate in volume type, there is no value
checking before mkfcmap.

This patch adds flashcopy_rate checking before make fcmap.

Change-Id: I7823749bd8add3ce41e4b2862fd0f06dd0fa0888
Closes-Bug:  1753908

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0ef8ed50f55fa905b6090805a3088fc5ab56906c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
deprecate old general configurations

In order to better support the growing list of
supported configurations we need to prune out the
older less tested configurations in src

Configurations required should be documented and
listed in https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/latest/feature-configuration.html

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553892/
Change-Id: I56fb4113d4615546ae4fb62e729b262fc985d0d1

commit_message:
Fixed the problem for SSL certificate access failure

When specify OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY = False, monascaclient
throws an exception when access alarms, alarm definitions
and notifictions.  Changed parameter cert to verify so it
takes boolean or passes the certificate file.

Also added unit tests for api.client

Story: 2001601
Task: 6555

Change-Id: Ib068bdc3fae1ebdb2bda8d7b6c24a725cef5b24b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550130
(cherry picked from commit c347cd2bf4f3b3f02e41f07edbf7960ff59110cd)

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora
messages: [{'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-27 19:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-03-27 20:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-03-27 21:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nLGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 19:06:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645

subject: Add spec for MFA auth receipts
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 10420, 'name': 'Adrian Turjak', 'email': 'devs+openstack@uncaught-exceptions.com', 'username': 'adriant'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 13063, 'name': 'WEI CHEN', 'email': 'dave.jungler@gmail.com', 'username': 'wei.d.chen'}, {'_account_id': 15054, 'name': 'wangxiyuan', 'email': 'wangxiyuan1007@gmail.com', 'username': 'wangxiyuan'}, {'_account_id': 16465, 'name': 'Kristi Nikolla', 'email': 'knikolla@bu.edu', 'username': 'knikolla'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-16 03:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like it.  The tricky part is going to be distinguishing between a partial-auth and unscoped.  We should use a consistant field between these two formats.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-16 20:00:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-16 20:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-16 20:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I like it.  The tricky part is going to be distinguishing between a
 > partial-auth and unscoped.  We should use a consistant field
 > between these two formats.

We could add a type field to the body with choices: scoped, unscoped, partial

Plus that would make even the different between scoped and unscoped much clearer in the body, as the only way I can see to infer that right now is extra fields are added. If that's how we prefer to do things, then we can just infer the same for partial if "required_auth_plugins" is present, but a type value may be clearer.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-16 20:39:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

And I'm sorry this spec has taken so long to appear and that MFA has kind of stalled because I was one of the main people pushing for it.

I know Morgan disagreed with me at the time, but I still think this spec is the only sensible way forward for MFA in OpenStack, and the true missing piece before we can start consuming it.

There will be a ton of follow up work after this spec is implemented, but this should give us all the tools we need to actually do that! Then we can potentially even look at adding U2F to Keystone and Horizon/CLI (which I know lots of people will use)."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-18 11:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

I'm going to start with a few comments:

"partial auth" is not going to work in the model of keystone without breaking the API contract. (hence the -2). If you issue a token, you're authenticated. All Stop.

That said, we can improve the MFA errors to inform the users what auth methods they must use. We already have a mechanism to raise up the error with information on what is required.

This is the way Keystone has to handle a challenge/response. As you can see, https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/230d0cfc6c5f6d497fc4751cae1832d4903e0352/keystone/exception.py#L272-L278 is not a security error, it is designed to pass data back to the user informing them what authentication methods are required.

It is not something we can fix by issuing partial tokens as some clients will be unable to distinguish (API CONTRACT), however, a 401 with an error is informing that we have insufficient methods, allowing a client that is smart enough to handle understadning what is needed and performing the subsequent steps without breaking the API contract of what an issued token means.

This can be handled in a bug, enhancing that 401. No spec is needed.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-03-18 16:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Morgan - the reason a descriptive error message alone isn't sufficient is provided in the "alternatives" section of this spec. We need to do a better job of being mindful of the dashboard use case.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-18 16:33:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

unfortunately, API compatibility contracts dictate that we cannot change the meaning of an issued token. We can create new APIs (paths) that could be used (perhaps with redirects, looking at modern auth pages it is usually: (1) UserID, (2) Password, (3) MFA [optional] -- or similar).

This type of change in response requires 100% new APIs that do not interrupt old API actions. An alternative would be to pass back with the Error a structured data (JSON) that a client could process indicating what AUTH mechanisms are needed so that it could act (I believe this was one of the original discussions we had around MFA). This is still well within BUG range does not need a spec.

The -2 stands until the following is well defined:

* Responses cannot be confused with tokens and must be handled by older clients the same as an Auth Failure.

* Smarter/Newer Clients should act upon whatever additional information is passed back and be able to act upon it for auth.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-18 20:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This doesn't break the API contract for any existing paths using the API. The new token would only ever be hit when and if MFA is enabled for a user or a cloud. We can even make that explicit in the code: Only return partial tokens if the user (or global default) has an auth rule with more than 1 methods that included the given method.

The contract is amended, and anyone who goes down the new path for the same API does so KNOWING the change and agreeing to the amendment. No one uses the current MFA auth rules that I'm aware of (please correct me if I'm wrong on that), and none of our tools really support it (KeystoneAuth doesn't). This will only ever be hit by someone who wants to use MFA, at which point this would be a new path on an existing API. Normal users or clouds which do not use the auth rules will not hit this at all.

I think that's sufficient enough safety and reason to be able to do this. When a cloud starts using auth rules, they know what they are getting themselves in for and that they should ensure everyone is using latest released tools before touching it.

We've just done a temporary MFA solution for our cloud using:
https://github.com/catalyst-cloud/adjutant-mfa
And we include a disclaimer that the enabling it for your user breaks v2 auth for them (by design). Given this would be a user or cloud admin controlled change, it is easier to let them manage it if they want to use the feature: "The use of this feature breaks old tools, please ensure you are using latest versions." etc.

As for the alternative, yes json error messages is better, but that's still a half measure, it's bad design, bad user experience, and if we encase that as the solution in Keystone now it's another thing we have to carry until we can do it right with v4 (and how far away is that?).

Having to resupply the data for each auth method is bad design. A half token was in the original spec, but they didn't realise how/why it would be useful. Now we can fix that mistake and make MFA in Keystone actually really good. True challenge respond, no resupplying password, good UX all around, something we can do interesting stuff with.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-18 23:50:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Worth adding, for anyone who does have MFA added, or a cloud which for very odd reasons sets it as the default, auth is broken anyway until you use new tools anyway because the old ones won't/don't support it.

The contract is broken when MFA is added by the user adding it, or the admin doing so. So why can't we take a a step further and make the process less awful? All you seem to want is to make sure the old tools still supply the same errors, but broken auth is still broken."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-19 00:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-19 00:05:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've update the spec partly to reflect Morgan's comments. I think using a 202 and making it VERY clear that this will never affect non-MFA users solves the worries he has in a way that should allow us to go forward without breaking authentication for anyone. No one will get unexpected responses, if they enable MFA, they know what they are getting, it's a different API contract."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:34:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-19 16:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

a 202/201 is still a change in fundamental behavior of the API. It is a contract break.

You would break any/all unware clients. This is not allowed.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-19 19:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-19 19:24:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> a 202/201 is still a change in fundamental behavior of the API. It
 > is a contract break.
 > 
 > You would break any/all unware clients. This is not allowed.

Give me a use-case/auth-path you are worried about. Examples would help me understand exactly what your worry is.

Are you worried about existing users of single method auth? Or users of the auth rules?

The former will not be affected. If you're worried about users of the auth rules, then yes, we'd want to break that. It's an undocumented, unadvertised, unfinished feature that no one uses. I'd rather we break that now and do it right rather than try and make it slightly better and have people stuck with that half-arsed solution until v4.

I was one of the main people pushing for MFA in keystone and I don't want to use the auth rules as they currently are because the lack of a partial token makes them mostly useless. So I'd be very very surprised if anyone else is using them."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-20 00:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-20 01:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Moving from -2 to -1, please see all in-line comments. Will provide subsequent reviews once we get the more significant things highlighted resolved.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-20 04:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-20 04:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-20 16:49:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(15 comments)

Looking really good, more comments, but we're not that far out."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-20 16:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:36:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(11 comments)

replied to some of Morgan's comments, will wait until others have added some review as well before I submit a new patch I think."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-03-20 19:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-20 19:41:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-20 23:06:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-20 23:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-03-20 23:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

One comment to get clarity on a 401 or 401.. otherwise this is looking good. Thanks, Adrian!'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

[{'created': '2018-03-22 15:40:01.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Expose python3 bug when cache_on_issue is False

We have a method that takes an integer and re-inflates it into a list
of authentication methods. This is because it's more efficient to
pass around an integer in a token's payload than a list of strings.
During the token validation process, we take this integer and run it
through a little process to reinflate it's value to a list of auth
methods that were used to obtain the original token.

The re-inflation process doesn't actually work in python3 because
it is coded to expect division operations to return integers, which
is accurate for python2. Python3 returns floats when dividing two
integers, which doesn't work with the logic to re-inflate the auth
methods. For example, in python 3::

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1.25
  >>> type(result)
  <class 'float'>

In python2:

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1
  >>> type(result)
  <type 'int'>

You can recreate this by initiating the token validation process
and disabling the CONF.token.cache_on_issue configuration option.

Change-Id: I627c2b353da0c35bb23bb40542a880fc6bacc4aa
"}, {'created': '2018-03-22 18:16:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix integer -> method conversion for python3

doesn't work with the logic to re-inflate the auth methods. For
example, in python 3::

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1.25
  >>> type(result)
  <class 'float'>

In python2:

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1
  >>> type(result)
  <type 'int'>

This commit introduces unit tests to prevent regression and includes
a fix so that the conversion works properly on python3.

Closes-Bug: 1758121
Change-Id: I627c2b353da0c35bb23bb40542a880fc6bacc4aa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix integer -> method conversion for python3

We have a method that takes an integer and re-inflates it into a list
of authentication methods. This is because it's more efficient to
pass around an integer in a token's payload than a list of strings.
During the token validation process, we take this integer and run it
through a little process to reinflate it's value to a list of auth
methods that were used to obtain the original token.

The re-inflation process doesn't actually work in python3 because it
is coded to expect integers when dividing numbers, which is accurate
for python2. Python3 returns floats when dividing two integers, which
doesn't work with the logic to re-inflate the auth methods. For
example, in python 3::

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1.25
  >>> type(result)
  <class 'float'>

In python2:

  >>> result = 5 / 4
  >>> result
  1
  >>> type(result)
  <type 'int'>

This commit introduces unit tests to prevent regression and includes
a fix so that the conversion works properly on python3.

Closes-Bug: 1758121
Change-Id: I627c2b353da0c35bb23bb40542a880fc6bacc4aa

commit_message:
Switch project neworks.ports to mock

In Python3, map() returns a map object. It is better to ensure to pass
an iterable object when the value is passed to another library.
_construct_parameters in networks/ports/workflows.py is updated.

Change-Id: I471a5620806b0b4e62604cc57dde2485fbdcf242
Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

[{'created': '2018-03-15 00:15:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tags and tags-any filter interaction

When combining tags and tags-any for project tags, the expected result,
which was specified in both the keystone[0] and api-wg[1] specs stated
that it would return any projects with all "tags" values  plus at least
one of the "tags-any" values. However the actual result was returning
both projects that only matched "tags" and projects that matched any of
the "tags-any" values.

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/project-tags.html
[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html#filtering-and-searching-by-tags

Change-Id: I632efdf0af2969be0a59dc5928a6c036eeca6051

'}, {'created': '2018-03-21 18:44:54.000000000', 'message': 'Make tags filter match subset rather than exact

Currently when using the "tags" filter to search projects by tag names,
the filter only matches project that have an exact match. Projects that
contain the exact tags given, but with additional tags are excluded.
This behavior is not compatible with the use cases defined in both the
keystone[0] and api-wg[1] specs, notibly with the "tags" and "tags-any"
interaction.

This change makes it so that "tags" filtering will be performed by
matching a subset containing given tags against projects, rather than
exact matching. This allows the "tags" and "tags-any" filters to work as
described in both [0] and [1].

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/project-tags.html

commit_message:
Make tags filter match subset rather than exact

Currently when using the "tags" filter to search projects by tag names,
the filter only matches projects that have an exact match. Projects that
contain the exact tags given, but with additional tags are excluded.
This behavior is not compatible with the use cases defined in both the
keystone[0] and api-wg[1] specs, notibly with the "tags" and "tags-any"
interaction.

This change makes it so that "tags" filtering will be performed by
matching a subset containing given tags against projects, rather than
exact matching. This allows the "tags" and "tags-any" filters to work as
described in both [0] and [1].

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/project-tags.html
[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html#filtering-and-searching-by-tags

Co-Authored By: Nicolas Helgeson <nh202b@att.com>

Closes-Bug: #1756190
Change-Id: I632efdf0af2969be0a59dc5928a6c036eeca6051

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 00:38:34.000000000', 'message': 'Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425
'}]
commit_message:
Remove inappropriate directory space check

Removes an inappropriate directory space check when copying an image to
a volume. In the general case, "dest" is a block device, so it's not
appropriate to check for space in the directory containing "dest". One
exception may be the NFS driver, where dest actually is a file, but that
should be handled elsewhere (if necessary). This check has always been
inappropriate, but was silently ineffective due to a unit-comparison bug
that was recently fixed.

Change-Id: Ie5eba32f92eb1740554bfc44baf612e326d6fde5
Closes-Bug: 1756425

OVN configuration was not done when deployed with
scenario007 as default for NeutronMl2PluginBase was
used which is neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml. This patch
fixes this to use neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml which
correctly configures neutron for ovn metadata.

Change-Id: I7cadd0567951b85c1ba69d4b4843ee29b67e7a11
Closes-Bug: #1757134
(cherry picked from commit e534a7a213294bdf8908addaa3b3da4e070a78dc)
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly set NeutronMl2PluginBase for OVN scenario

OVN configuration was not done when deployed with
scenario007 as default for NeutronMl2PluginBase was
used which is neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml. This patch
fixes this to use neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml which
correctly configures neutron for ovn metadata.

Change-Id: I7cadd0567951b85c1ba69d4b4843ee29b67e7a11
Closes-Bug: #1757134
(cherry picked from commit e534a7a213294bdf8908addaa3b3da4e070a78dc)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ie9af7f8458571e89a91bac8497c3cd8612fdcb35
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Amend the migration paging spec for uuid in server migrations response

During the review of I7e01f95d7173d9217f76e838b3ea71555151ef56
we made the decision to also add the migration uuid to the server
migrations GET responses to be consistent with the os-migrations
change to add the uuid to the response. This change simply amends
the spec to mention that change as well.

Part of blueprint add-pagination-and-change-since-for-migration-list

Change-Id: Icdd598d34748240a3ed9dade561f8f34857adbc3

commit_message:
Don't assume nodepool.[private|public]_ipv4

Several places assume nodepool.[private|public]_ipv4 are set, which
may not be true in ipv6 environments like limestone.  Rework several
of the setup and checks to not assume they are there.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556784
Change-Id: I8cbe78bc127652229917d9e7f531a95f4b6fb0f7

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-28 01:22:59.000000000', 'message': "Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack

With devstack change I86104824a29d973a6288df1f24b7891feb86267c we have
started caching the etcd .tar.gz on nodes during daily builds.  Thus
currently this flag doesn't really do anything, because we source the
file from the local cache directory.

Only in the cache-miss fallback case does devstack try to download.
Really the only reason this happens is because we're trying to use a
new version, and since that won't be on tarballs.o.o without
intervention it makes thing unnecessarily complicated.  Thus remove
this set.

Change-Id: I8fab8efdb0259a34047e19bec965d3c694de5092
"}]
commit_message:
Remove ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL setting for devstack

With devstack change I86104824a29d973a6288df1f24b7891feb86267c we have
started caching the etcd .tar.gz on nodes during daily builds.  Thus
currently this flag doesn't really do anything, because we source the
file from the local cache directory.

Only in the cache-miss fallback case does devstack try to download.
Really the only reason this happens is because we're trying to use a
new version, and since that won't be on tarballs.o.o without
intervention it makes thing unnecessarily complicated.  Thus remove
this set.

Change-Id: I8fab8efdb0259a34047e19bec965d3c694de5092

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0477df2f4275b79380a8a277de38f97884938e3c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-01-02 17:18:53.000000000', 'message': "tox.ini: Add Python 2.7 as 'basepython' for 'pep8' target

For systems with Python-3, you might hit some Py2.7 vs Py3.6 compat
errors.  The upstream CI gate (that uses Ubuntu) uses Python 2 -- so
we're good there.

While at it, remove the stale 'minversion = 1.4' (and the accompanying
comment).

Change-Id: Ib6a8470fff06b95bb82c262212c671b5ee5d07a5

the jobs more quickly.

commit_message:
Remove option standalone_network_plugin_ip_version

'standalone_network_plugin_ip_version' option has been
deprecated. This option has been replaced by
'network_plugin_ipv4_enabled' and
'network_plugin_ipv6_enabled' options.

Change-Id: I0251fecddac74578698bcda5d46e44ca16bd8a76

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I8596b2a4d38c43cfa18e4dfa0c15990326ecc75c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
After run manila tempest the share network residue

After run manila tempest with multi-tenancy there have manila share network residue.
This manila share network should be deleted in clear resources.

Change-Id: I91060888f3509b1e84a453847a7aa3ebcfbf01c9
Closes-Bug:#1754588

subject: Augment object-expirer's StatsD buckets.
messages: [{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-25 20:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-26 01:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-03-13 22:29:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-03-27 18:49:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 20:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'Augment object-expirer's StatsD buckets.

This commit adds three new StatsD buckets to the object expirer:

* object-expirer.deferred: times that the object DELETE attempt gets a
  404 or 412 and the expirer decides to retry the deletion later.

* object-expirer.bad_status: times that an unexpected status code was
  received from an object deletion attempt. Currently, this is
  everything except 2xx, 404, 409, and 412.

* object-expirer.dequeue: deletions of rows from the expirer queue,
  i.e. the containers in the ".expiring_objects" account.

Hopefully, this will give operators more visibility into what the
object expirer is doing.

Change-Id: I470c721c56c15817316d1042398227694f3f2aa0
'}, {'created': '2018-01-26 01:20:23.000000000', 'message': 'Augment object-expirer's StatsD buckets.

* object-expirer.dequeue: deletions of rows from the expirer queue,

This commit adds three new StatsD buckets to the object expirer:

* object-expirer.deferred: times that the object DELETE attempt gets a
  404 or 412 and the expirer decides to retry the deletion later.

* object-expirer.bad_status: times that an unexpected status code was
  received from an object deletion attempt. Currently, this is
  everything except 2xx, 404, 409, and 412.

* object-expirer.dequeue: deletions of rows from the expirer queue,
  i.e. the containers in the ".expiring_objects" account.

Hopefully, this will give operators more visibility into what the
object expirer is doing.

Change-Id: I470c721c56c15817316d1042398227694f3f2aa0
'}]
commit_message:
Augment object-expirer's StatsD buckets.

This commit adds three new StatsD buckets to the object expirer:

* object-expirer.deferred: times that the object DELETE attempt gets a
  404 or 412 and the expirer decides to retry the deletion later.

* object-expirer.bad_status: times that an unexpected status code was
  received from an object deletion attempt. Currently, this is
  everything except 2xx, 404, 409, and 412.

* object-expirer.dequeue: deletions of rows from the expirer queue,
  i.e. the containers in the ".expiring_objects" account.

Hopefully, this will give operators more visibility into what the
object expirer is doing.

Change-Id: I470c721c56c15817316d1042398227694f3f2aa0

commit_message:
Expose vlan trunking in metadata/configdrive

This proposal aims to expose vlan subinterfaces associatecd with trunk
ports in metadata and configdrive, with which cloud-init (or possibly
glean) can configure the vlan subinterfaces in the guest instances.

Change-Id: I23b4e98e8cdd380f52d18855b9a9d5163756b728

[{'account_id': 27678, 'date': '2018-02-06 01:57:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-06 01:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21690, 'date': '2018-02-06 02:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27566, 'date': '2018-02-06 02:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-02-06 04:39:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27496, 'date': '2018-02-06 07:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

We need to check out each repository to the hash for the latest
release on the branch to check the sdist name because (a) the name may
change over time and (b) the setup.py file may be removed from master
after a project is retired.

Change-Id: Id207d2ee7e2b70ffad562c7912a0543a4b9f9750
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
look at correct branch when determining the sdist name

We need to check out each repository to the hash for the latest
release on the branch to check the sdist name because (a) the name may
change over time and (b) the setup.py file may be removed from master
after a project is retired.

Change-Id: Id207d2ee7e2b70ffad562c7912a0543a4b9f9750
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 13:43:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
(cherry picked from commit 1a35d6dc81b96b34f1b5251540afcbe62f2fb0d2)

commit_message:
more robustly handle error when we can't determine sdist name

Instead of passing None to the service as the sdist name, report that
situation as an error.

Change-Id: Ib6380d997db780ae324a4df61fdfa7f17e4507c3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
api-ref: Parameter verification for servers.inc (1/3)

This patch verifies query parameters.
Subsequent patches will verify other parameters.

Change-Id: I6078c0c8ebc888dc120f446f228a3b0433b89a76
Partial-Bug: #1738930

commit_message:
Fix parameter error in image_utils

Ref patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514658/

1. Fix parameter error of method fetch_to_volume_format that
   called in fetch_to_raw and fetch_to_vhd.
2. Add new parameter volume_subformat for fetch_to_vhd to keep
   the same business with [Ref patch].

Change-Id: Id30ffd8a40eca841b5d6461c2f0269a0d9a4d628

[{'created': '2018-02-17 18:30:37.000000000', 'message': 'Process conntrack updates in worker threads

With a large number of instances and/or security group rules,
conntrack updates when ports are removed or rules are changed
can take a long time to process.  By enqueuing these to a set
or worker threads, the agent can continue with other work while
they are processed in the background.

This is a change in behavior in the agent since it could
program a new set of security group rules before all existing
conntrack entries are deleted, but since the iptables or OVSfw
NAT rules will have been removed, it should not pose a
security issue.

Change-Id: Ibf858c7fdf7a822a30e4a0c4722d70fd272741b6
Closes-bug: #1745468
(cherry picked from commit 65a81623fc0377b26d2d5800607f7c3acc08c45a)

commit_message:
Process conntrack updates in worker threads

With a large number of instances and/or security group rules,
conntrack updates when ports are removed or rules are changed
can take a long time to process.  By enqueuing these to a set
or worker threads, the agent can continue with other work while
they are processed in the background.

This is a change in behavior in the agent since it could
program a new set of security group rules before all existing
conntrack entries are deleted, but since the iptables or OVSfw
NAT rules will have been removed, it should not pose a
security issue.

Change-Id: Ibf858c7fdf7a822a30e4a0c4722d70fd272741b6
Closes-bug: #1745468
(cherry picked from commit 65a81623fc0377b26d2d5800607f7c3acc08c45a)

commit_message:
Fix post up checksum script

The post up checksum script was being executed by the legacy networking
To ensure we retain the same capabilities the checksum fix script has
been moved into a systemd oneshot service.

Change-Id: I58d393eb8c78a541142a29c5e0678cbd6ec18b65
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

remove the ZMQ driver. This is the first part of doing that, which

commit_message:
remove zmq tests

At the Rocky PTG the Oslo team decided to once again deprecate and
remove the ZMQ driver. This is the first part of doing that, which
removes the unit tests and extra functional test jobs, which are
failing.

Change-Id: Ia02adf122d2d4ff281e7c9fd3dff8894da241925
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove required-projects from job definition

Given that the parent is the functional job, which already
includes all the required roles, this is unnecessary and
only serves to slow down the test.

Change-Id: Iadcebc9eca9e279ea647a7a35bff5d00f82489f1

commit_message:
Fix fluentd upgrade tasks during FFU.

The upgrade task doesn't check for the service existence which make
the upgrade fails during ffu.

We're using the set_facts idiom as it persist between steps.

Closes-Bug: #1757985

Change-Id: I1d3ccd7d3fb641d187f214c20f1d6a4d6113304a

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525607/

Change-Id: Ib816887f07f16b6ac865bb81d0f27f12d0b47dfb
Closes-Bug: #1754770
(cherry picked from commit 8be0c2a551fea0c02d757c6ad460f8435423ec32)
'}]
commit_message:
Set trusted port only once in iptables firewall driver

Patch [1] added configuration of forward rule for trusted ports in
iptables firewall driver.

This patch fixes issue with many "duplicate iptables rule detected"
warning messages due to try to add such forward rule each time when
trusted port is updated.
Now such rule is added only once for port.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525607/

Change-Id: Ib816887f07f16b6ac865bb81d0f27f12d0b47dfb
Closes-Bug: #1754770
(cherry picked from commit 8be0c2a551fea0c02d757c6ad460f8435423ec32)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 02:28:35.000000000', 'message': 'Amend volume multi-attach spec

* The minimum required Cinder API microversion that Nova
  checks for is 3.44.
* The first TODO about disallowing a volume to be attached to
  the same instance multiple times has been resolved by
  change I049f00f993e45eeb090a1e1a5e5696cf2f103187.
* The second TODO about adding a new microversion is removed;
  we added microversion 2.60 for multiattach volume support in nova.

Change-Id: I12efa58b95ba1a2f8615256924f4a7a44c354ced
'}]
commit_message:
Amend volume multi-attach spec

* The minimum required Cinder API microversion that Nova
  checks for is 3.44.
* The first TODO about disallowing a volume to be attached to
  the same instance multiple times has been resolved by
  change I049f00f993e45eeb090a1e1a5e5696cf2f103187.
* The second TODO about adding a new microversion is removed;
  we added microversion 2.60 for multiattach volume support in nova.

Change-Id: I12efa58b95ba1a2f8615256924f4a7a44c354ced

[{'created': '2018-03-21 20:41:41.000000000', 'message': 'Dell EMC SC: Find volume folder API call fails on root folders

Changes to the SC API have changed how calls are made to the
StorageCenter/ScVolumeFolder/GetList payload filter options. In
the case of a folder under root this call could fail depending on
the API.

Change-Id: I2ab2160478d2163dbb45175aa5f1b884f316db24
(cherry picked from commit c9a7fb8da533251772b79140c7161b393c52f15b)
'}]
commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Find volume folder API call fails on root folders

Changes to the SC API have changed how calls are made to the
StorageCenter/ScVolumeFolder/GetList payload filter options. In
the case of a folder under root this call could fail depending on
the API.

Change-Id: I2ab2160478d2163dbb45175aa5f1b884f316db24
(cherry picked from commit c9a7fb8da533251772b79140c7161b393c52f15b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 08:44:11.000000000', 'message': "tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062
Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0
"}]
commit_message:
tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062
Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-03-26 18:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

pbr, oslo.config, and oslo.messaging had removals that require
major releases.

Change-Id: I3666f776f9a9f69e7252aa164541ab4ff21b0af6
'}]
commit_message:
Oslo releases for 2018-3-27

pbr, oslo.config, and oslo.messaging had removals that require
major releases.

Change-Id: I3666f776f9a9f69e7252aa164541ab4ff21b0af6

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Idd1779c38f0fcd49130971d4eb2679247af796ce
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
queens: release 8.0.1 for tripleo THT

9.0.0.0b1 was pushed by error, and in fact we want 8.0.1.
A note was added for Rocky so we know that we need to push higher than
9.0.0.0b1 for rocky-m1.

Change-Id: Ib849fa1552c0d0ee76075197e9aca90d1deea1bb

commit_message:
Set trusted flag for configure-mirrors test

As our mirrors aren't signed, we need to set this flag in order for
tests to pass when running on Ubuntu Bionic.

Change-Id: I2cbbda65e69f1f055d62e06286add215f9182102

Hi, while I greatly appreciate the initiative here, before going ahead with this and the client-side patch, first step is to document how the gaps identified in Ocata [1] have been addressed. My suggestion would be to post a patch to the specs repo as first step and elaborate how gaps have been addressed or are going to be addressed. Then we can look at patches (like this one) in the context of the assessment to make sure we're not forgetting anything.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/stadium/ocata/neutron-vpnaas.html"}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2017-03-31 01:51:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Migrate neutron-vpnaas API definitions to neutron-lib

Neutron-vpnaas is intending to bring back into the stadium.
So, neutron-vpnaas must migrate it's API definition to neutron-lib.

Co-Authored-By: Anh Tran <trananhkma@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Hunt Xu <mhuntxu@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I06760fbbbc87570412a21364fba58efe880a907b

commit_message:
Use wait_random_exponential from tenacity 4.4.0

Now that we depend on tenacity >=4.4.0, we can use the library's version of
the wait_random_exponential wait strategy in place of our own.

Change-Id: I13d3222808a98ef7e333f58df931c8f950ac1221
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556309

commit_message:
Re-enable Limestone at 10 nodes with custom labels

This will allow us to troubleshoot issues we've noticed with Limestone.
Using custom labels means normal jobs won't be impacted.

Change-Id: I28748caf5ee8d059a25d9c38429e0ad57c99b8b5

[{'created': '2018-03-27 15:46:29.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: Ensure Open vSwitch is started for all providers that need it

Previously, openvswitch was only started when we were using the ODL
provider but we should start it for all providers that need it. As such
we move the conditional which checks whether Open vSwitch is needed into
a new variable and we use that to start/enable the service and also to
install the package when needed.

Change-Id: I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f
(cherry picked from commit 4b940c8337017dcfb275f3eba90f4e8f5fa6dffc)
'}]
commit_message:
tasks: Ensure Open vSwitch is started for all providers that need it

Previously, openvswitch was only started when we were using the ODL
provider but we should start it for all providers that need it. As such
we move the conditional which checks whether Open vSwitch is needed into
a new variable and we use that to start/enable the service and also to
install the package when needed.

Change-Id: I4ec4fc2c2124a941f24478cbdf39ed34c0dce56f
(cherry picked from commit 4b940c8337017dcfb275f3eba90f4e8f5fa6dffc)

commit_message:
bump fs20 tempest to 3 workers

Tempest is timing out in the tripleo promotion jobs.
Let's see if bumping the workers from 2 to 3 speeds
it up enough and if it stays reliable.

Change-Id: I37433a0297874a19b33e7b425e1bb2716e7e176b

commit_message:
Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130

[{'created': '2018-03-22 20:54:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove /etc/os-net-config/config.json in /us/libexec/os-apply-config

In the new style of nic config files, os-net-config is invoked by
the script run-os-net-config.sh, not by os-apply-config.  This is the
only format supported in Queens. Remove the os-apply-config version
of /etc/os-net-config/config.json to prevent os-apply-config from
attempting to run with an empty config.json file.

Change-Id: Ica86382c4e5a1463ed8b2146e3ec490b7e2c9452
Closes-Bug: 1758161
'}, {'created': '2018-03-22 22:46:11.000000000', 'message': 'Remove /etc/os-net-config/config.json in os-apply-config

In the new style of nic config files, os-net-config is invoked by
the script run-os-net-config.sh, not by os-apply-config.  This is the
only format supported in Queens. Remove the os-apply-config version
of /etc/os-net-config/config.json to prevent os-apply-config from
attempting to run with an empty config.json file.

Note that /etc/os-net-config/config.json no longer exists in
tripleo-image-elements.

Change-Id: Ica86382c4e5a1463ed8b2146e3ec490b7e2c9452
Closes-Bug: 1758161
'}]
commit_message:
Remove /etc/os-net-config/config.json in os-apply-config

In the new style of nic config files, os-net-config is invoked by
the script run-os-net-config.sh, not by os-apply-config.  This is the
only format supported in Queens. Remove the os-apply-config version
of /etc/os-net-config/config.json to prevent os-apply-config from
attempting to run with an empty config.json file.

Note that /etc/os-net-config/config.json no longer exists in
tripleo-image-elements.

Change-Id: Ica86382c4e5a1463ed8b2146e3ec490b7e2c9452
Closes-Bug: 1758161

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iec6e055c97a440ac62ea684fe0130a4f53ed27bb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/553063
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 20:45:44.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

Change-Id: Ib7d66460c21e3dbcf2d55d7ecac23315daa65ec7
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

Change-Id: Ib7d66460c21e3dbcf2d55d7ecac23315daa65ec7

commit_message:
Share overcloud Heat templates for undercloud conf

Now that we have --use-heat mode by default, allow
to alter the default location of tripleo heat templates for
undercloud as well.

Move related cleanup and output dir to the expected DEFAULT
namespace.

Related-bug: #1749683
Change-Id: I050c09c4447fa45dd6e82dc3199bec60b1a10696
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix routings headers

The current implementation that remaps the headers of jobs objects
fails in python3. This change simplify the implementation and fixes
the current failures.

Change-Id: I6620a8aeff2b678ab07ae9a55ef2f1e481bdef5d
(cherry picked from commit 8f21b50e4ce3b20a8ecabc97947634a55d8c497e)

commit_message:
Create migration context for live-migration

Since a5b920a external instance event routing is
done by checking migration_context for instance.
The problem here is that claims aren't used for
live-migration yet, and no migration_context is created.

This patch fixes this problem by explicitly creating
migration_context on conductor's side, to ensure routing will
work properly.

While this change is a hotfix the rationale for doing that it's
backportable nature.

Change-Id: Id4d3e856c33d16fe80af46aa3c3f6edb77ab2269
Related-Bug: #1414559

Change I6c5eafe76eb53bc38d100a9ba132dd8fe6dd2d5f removed old
update-related resources, but it seems that we need to do such removal
in two steps to allow smooth transition for existing stacks: first
remove them from the stack, and only then completely remove the
mapping from resource registry. If we try to do both at the same time,
we get:

ERROR: The Resource Type (OS::TripleO::Tasks::UpdateWorkflow) could
not be found.

So we'll need to keep these resource registry entries around (even
though mapped to OS::Heat::None) for the Rocky cycle still. They can
be removed in S.

commit_message:
Allow stacks to remove old update resources

Change I6c5eafe76eb53bc38d100a9ba132dd8fe6dd2d5f removed old
update-related resources, but it seems that we need to do such removal
in two steps to allow smooth transition for existing stacks: first
remove them from the stack, and only then completely remove the
mapping from resource registry. If we try to do both at the same time,
we get:

ERROR: The Resource Type (OS::TripleO::Tasks::UpdateWorkflow) could
not be found.

So we'll need to keep these resource registry entries around (even
though mapped to OS::Heat::None) for the Rocky cycle still. They can
be removed in S.

Change-Id: I866e659bd373dfb2816508165b7f3abb9580e2d0
Closes-Bug: #1758014

commit_message:
Allow overriding a compute node's UUID

Enable the compute node's UUID to be overridden when a provider config
YAML file is present on the compute host.

Change-Id: Ice67f962a582276f2026bfbf96e3bf430643ff64
blueprint: override-compute-node-uuid

commit_message:
Amend the "add extra-specs to flavor" for create and update API

1. The response of ``POST /flavors`` and ``PUT /flavors/{flavor_id}``
also needs to add the ``extra-specs`` in response to keep consist.
2. Fix typo in bp.
3. Change primary assignee and other contributors.

Part of blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I2d2523da038e5f4e5547eb74180786429e817912

to experimental. To trigger the job, comment "check experimental" in a
Gerrit review.

subject: Upgrade data on disk on mysql major upgrade - non HA
messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2018-03-27 08:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-03-27 09:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-03-27 12:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 08:59:10.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade data on disk on mysql major upgrade - non HA

During major upgrade of non-HA overcloud, paunch stops the
containerized mysql service, update container image and restart
the containerized mysql.

After a major update of mysql (e.g. 5.5 to 10.0), run mysql_upgrade
to ensure that database on-disk is upgraded to match the mysql
server version (e.g. update all MyISAM tables)

The mysql_upgrade cannot be performed during upgrade_steps because
paunch only runs during the deploy_steps. So run it in the
post_upgrade_steps, once we know paunch has updated mysql.

Change-Id: I6b6a531fd716ad9abcbf29886c0b1f2c64f04c9d
(cherry picked from commit 02f860916897bfa29392f4d2ebaef83d5bef3adb)
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade data on disk on mysql major upgrade - non HA

During major upgrade of non-HA overcloud, paunch stops the
containerized mysql service, update container image and restart
the containerized mysql.

After a major update of mysql (e.g. 5.5 to 10.0), run mysql_upgrade
to ensure that database on-disk is upgraded to match the mysql
server version (e.g. update all MyISAM tables)

The mysql_upgrade cannot be performed during upgrade_steps because
paunch only runs during the deploy_steps. So run it in the
post_upgrade_steps, once we know paunch has updated mysql.

Change-Id: I6b6a531fd716ad9abcbf29886c0b1f2c64f04c9d
(cherry picked from commit 02f860916897bfa29392f4d2ebaef83d5bef3adb)

commit_message:
Remove the sql token driver and uuid token provider

Both of these drivers were staged for removal in Rocky. Now that
Rocky is open for development we can remove them. This commit removes
just the bare-bones aspects of each. Subsequent patches will do the
following:

  - Remove test class that were only meant for sql or uuid scenarios
  - Refactor the notification framework to not hint at token storage
  - Refactor the token provider API interfaces to be simpler and
    cleaner
  - Remove the needs_persistence property from the token provider API
    and document the ability to push that logic into individual
    providers that require it
  - Return 403 Forbidden for all requests to fetch a revocation list
  - Remove the signing directory configuration options

These changes will result in simpler interfaces which will be
important for people implementing their own token providers and
storage layers.

bp removed-as-of-rocky

Change-Id: I76d5c29f6b1572ee3ec7f2b1af63ff31572de2ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-11 08:55:17.000000000', 'message': "Few correction in the server filter/sort spec

server filter/sort spec (add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters.rst)
is implemented in ocata but there are 'all_tenants' behavior
and policy changes mentioned in this spec which actually did not get
implemented.

Those proposed changes were rediscussed in API meeting [1] to implement in
a different way [2] which again not completed yet.

There was no consensus on direction that time and need more broad discussion
to make 'all_tenants' bits as better UX.

But anyways we should cleanup the implemented spec with things
not yet done. Otherwise people might get wrong impressions about 'all_tenants'
changes.

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params which are implemented in schema but missing in
spec's whitelist:
 - Add 'created_at' and 'change_since' in filter params list
 - Add 'creacted_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. Remove the 'all_tenants' proposed changes which are not implemented yet.

We will further discuss/plan the 'all_tenants' proposal as fresh spec.

.. 1 http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html
.. 2 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426128/1  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425533/3

2. Remove the 'all_tenants' proposed changes which are not implemented yet.

We will further discuss/plan the 'all_tenants' proposal as fresh spec.

.. 1 http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html
.. 2 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426128/  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425533/

Change-Id: Ibdcc5cae3b73c0aa0d3e0a785c827682df0483ca
"}]
commit_message:
Few correction in the server filter/sort spec

server filter/sort spec (add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters.rst)
is implemented in ocata but there are 'all_tenants' behavior
and policy changes mentioned in this spec which actually did not get
implemented.

Those proposed changes were rediscussed in API meeting [1] to implement in
a different way [2] which again not completed yet.

There was no consensus on direction that time and need more broad discussion
to make 'all_tenants' bits as better UX.

But anyways we should cleanup the implemented spec with things
not yet done. Otherwise people might get wrong impressions about 'all_tenants'
changes.

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params which are implemented in schema but missing in
spec's whitelist:
 - Add 'created_at' and 'changes-since' in filter params list
 - Add 'created_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. Remove the 'all_tenants' proposed changes which are not implemented yet.

We will further discuss/plan the 'all_tenants' proposal as fresh spec.

.. 1 http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html
.. 2 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426128/  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/425533/

Change-Id: Ibdcc5cae3b73c0aa0d3e0a785c827682df0483ca

commit_message:
Remove usage of the reserved keyword id

There are places in the code where id is being assigned to a variable,
overwritting the reserved keyword.

This patch renames those variables as to not overwrite the keyword.

Change-Id: I1af1f1904b060c191752c87016ed2e303b3f70fc
Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
update required kernel

The required kernel was set to 4.2 though that's not an option in
xenial. This change updates the required kernel to 4.4.

Change-Id: I09c4c241f0c4ba1e62a34d76fd3f7ce8d6486c6f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 72a9838583231dd78ad56342aaee2f2af29358cc)

commit_message:
Add release note for nova_default_schedule_zone

Change Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c implemented a change
in defaults, but did not include a release note. This patch adds a
release note to inform deployers of the change.

Fix routings headers

The current implementation that remaps the headers of jobs objects
fails in python3. This change simplify the implementation and fixes
the current failures.

commit_message:
Add release note for nova_default_schedule_zone

Change Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c implemented a change
in defaults, but did not include a release note. This patch adds a
release note to inform deployers of the change.

Change-Id: Ia7f175b3655733f0868f52caff417a262bb14ecb
Related-Bug: 1730918
Signed-off-by: Kevin Lefevre <kevin.lefevre@osones.io>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-18 17:51:10.000000000', 'message': "Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently

Configuring a service_type that is not the official service type for a
service is a mess, and something that should not be necessary. Update
the spec to indicate that default service_type values should be used in
the absence of an override (although against my better judgement leave
the option to configure one as a get-out-of-jail card) In order to do
that cleanly, also ditch the concept of a single value that is a colon
separated tuple, since that form is not used to indicate an OpenStack
service pretty much anywhere else. Remove the service_name completely,
as it's completely pointless in a Nova config.

Also, mention that instead of implementing code directly in Nova to do
some of the grosser logic needed for this, that we can just use
os-client-config which already does all of the logic required.

Change-Id: Iaa0ba24331c3d506ce34607b369c85868cdfc9d7
"}]
commit_message:
Implement use-service-catalog-for-endpoints differently

Configuring a service_type that is not the official service type for a
service is a mess, and something that should not be necessary. Update
the spec to indicate that default service_type values should be used in
the absence of an override (although against my better judgement leave
the option to configure one as a get-out-of-jail card) In order to do
that cleanly, also ditch the concept of a single value that is a colon
separated tuple, since that form is not used to indicate an OpenStack
service pretty much anywhere else. Remove the service_name completely,
as it's completely pointless in a Nova config.

Also, mention that instead of implementing code directly in Nova to do
some of the grosser logic needed for this, that we can just use
os-client-config which already does all of the logic required.

Change-Id: Iaa0ba24331c3d506ce34607b369c85868cdfc9d7

[{'created': '2017-01-26 04:57:13.000000000', 'message': "Few updates on server filter/sort spec

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params are missing in spec's whitelist:
 -  Add 'created_at' and 'change_since' in filter params list

commit_message:
Few updates on server filter/sort spec

This commit does the below change to server filter/sort spec:

1. Some valid params are missing in spec's whitelist:
 -  Add 'created_at' and 'change_since' in filter params list
 -  Add 'creacted_at' and 'updated_at' in sort param list

2. all_tenant Rule(old or new) should not change the API behvaiour
   Making new rule soft enforcement(no 403) actually changes the API
   behaviour and can break upgrade. This behaviour changes needs
   version bump.
   Details: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_api/2017/nova_api.2017-01-25-13.00.log.html

partial implement of bp add-whitelist-for-server-list-filter-sort-parameters

Change-Id: I0d51037b99c023d63dc3bef63a9190b498cd87b8

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: I69d9d1b8b5ea7c62425e1d38e7f551ebe3cc57c3
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

for more details.

Change-Id: I2115c1c13e609c3f720c44f38f5562cead456373
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2115c1c13e609c3f720c44f38f5562cead456373
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Ansible playbook to generate I18n Extra-ATCs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 6882, 'name': 'Thomas SJ Kang', 'display_name': 'ujuc', 'email': 'community@ujuc.me', 'username': 'sungjin'}, {'_account_id': 14482, 'name': 'Ian Y. Choi', 'email': 'ianyrchoi@gmail.com', 'username': 'ianychoi'}, {'_account_id': 17765, 'name': 'Frank Kloeker', 'email': 'f.kloeker@telekom.de', 'username': 'eumel8'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-07 13:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-10 12:15:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

IMHO python script is much easier to understand and debug compared to ansible playbook in this case. I use both ansible and python heavily but I don't see any value of using ansible playbook in this case."}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-01-11 07:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am not too much familiar with Ansible so it is difficult to figure out how the script can be executed using ansible command. Would u also provide a simple explanation as comments in yml file or some README in tools/zanata directory? For this point of view, I now cannot review this patch unfortunately.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-12 18:54:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Hi Akihiro, you are definitly right. I should maintain and extend the existing Python scripts. But my Python skills are very limited and I was supposed to create Extra ATC list till end of this week. Ansible works here as expected but it's hard on the limit what Ansible can handle. 
I want to share with you my solution. If the official repo is not the right place I can maintain this also in my own Github account. On the other hand Ansible is a standard in the community. So I'm not completely wrong ;)"}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-12 19:02:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Ianychoi, first you have to install Ansible (like "pip install ansible==2.3.0.0"). Playbooks have a hosts section, "localhost" means the playbook will execute local on your computer. Variables are defined in global section or in tasks. Tasks are executed serial, mostly modules are used like "file" or "uri". You can also use "shell" to execute a shell command in a task. If there are multiple tasks to one function you can export this to roles.
And the call of the script is very simple:
ansible-playbook generate_atc.yml
I added a commend in the script for usage'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-12 19:02:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-13 13:59:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> On the other hand Ansible is a standard in the community. So I'm not completely wrong ;)

Ansible is an official tool in our infra but I am not sure it is an official programming language of individual project teams.

My comment is mainly from the perspective of programmability and readability.
Once we added something, it is not easy to drop it. I am worrying how we can maintain it in the longer term."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-13 14:04:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I cannot verify the change is okay or not as I have no access to the info.

From the maintenance point of view, could you prepare a directory for the playbook. I think we will have a random content under tools/zanata after it is merged.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-13 14:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If we add this to the repo, as Ian commented, I believe we need README on how to use this and how to get input files.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-15 10:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-15 11:02:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

This playbook is hard for me to review. I won't post -1 but I cannot give +1/+2 score. I think it is okay to approve it by yourself (as your PTL right) :)"}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-01-16 03:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(10 comments)

I briefly commented based on my first round of review.

By the way, do you have some clues for the following error message from my local trial?

- fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"failed": true, "msg": "ERROR! template error while templating string: no filter named 'json_query'"}'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-17 20:43:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(6 comments)

thx again for your really helpful reviews.
Akihiro: I wouldn't push that in the repo without your approval. As I already mentioned, I could maintain this in my own github repo, but I shared this here to support the PTL work. In the next cycle we should have Zanata 4, were many things will going better.
Ian: Regarding your error message. It seems your Ansible version is too old. You need at least 2.2.0.0. A put a comment in die Readme.rst"}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-17 20:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-19 11:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-01-25 16:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-01-25 16:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

- I found http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/ansible-role-jenkins/tree/tox.ini#n10 which was helpful to revise to Patch 6.
- jmespath was needed not to see: "You need to install \"jmespath\" prior to running json_query filter"

By the way, would you give me some hints for the following error?
- "Unexpected templating type error occurred on ({{ workingdir }}/stats.{{ item|hash('sha1') }} ): update() argument 1 must be string or buffer, not dict"'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-31 16:15:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

alright, added a comment in the ansible-requirement.txt
The error means item is not a string. you can run ansible-playbook -vvvv to catch the content of the variable.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-01-31 16:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-02-07 04:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hmm, I still get the same error: http://paste.openstack.org/show/664509/'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-02-12 08:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Can you check the content of workingdir? It should contain 2 sorts of files: the user data set in form "user.<username" and "stats.<sha>".
I think this is in the wrong format on your site or the whole sha files are missing'}, {'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2018-02-12 17:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-02-15 21:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-02-15 21:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-02-15 21:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2018-02-18 06:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

:)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-05 13:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I hope someone who can test this script actually will approve this patch, i.e., Ian? I will put +1 if my static review is okay.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-06 16:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I am currently more focusing on project doc translation support but yes I would like to test this script. Hopefully, there will be more new I18n PTLs so more people can test this script :)

 > I hope someone who can test this script actually will approve this
 > patch, i.e., Ian? I will put +1 if my static review is okay.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-25 14:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-25 14:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-25 14:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

I successfully ran this and share my log: http://paste.openstack.org/show/712848/'}, {'account_id': 6882, 'date': '2018-03-27 16:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

구래잇!

Great!'}]

[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I also realize this is a backport but something is wrong here. OSA shouldn't have to create these directories in the same manner that users do not have to create these directories in advance before installing ovs."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the problem you are trying to solve is fixed by https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/commit/4b940c8337017dcfb275f3eba90f4e8f5fa6dffc

so maybe worth reverting your commit on master and backporting the above fix to Pike to resolve that bug.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-27 16:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Create ovs temp directories when using ovs

This change creates a tmpfiles file and related directories when using
any "ovs" based plugin.

Change-Id: I616880bc6883eacb8393bbcaabaccccdd2665200
Closes-Bug: #1754144
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7ba9b763828155ba4ec639b92017061b013a2f5f)
