commit_message:
Allows Configuration of Neutron Parameter

Using this, users can assign already available parameter
ovs_integration_bridge in neutron.conf

Change-Id: Id9690e1b34740d26f49bb1db559e0c49d2a6bc26
Closes-Bug: 1752918

subject: table: Show checkbox only when there is BatchAction
messages:
[{'account_id': 25946, 'date': '2017-12-14 09:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25946, 'date': '2017-12-14 10:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-15 11:03:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Could you describe a case where the current implementation is not good? Why do we need to limit table actions only to BatchAction? Why do you think a normal Action or LinkAction cannot be placed as a table action?'}, {'account_id': 25946, 'date': '2017-12-20 07:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Could you describe a case where the current implementation is not
 > good? Why do we need to limit table actions only to BatchAction?
 > Why do you think a normal Action or LinkAction cannot be placed as
 > a table action?

As a table action ,the normal Action or LinkAction is ok.
But,the checkbox could also be as batch box.The checkbox in the first column is visibility only when the table actions contain the BatchAction.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2017-12-20 13:28:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

> As a table action ,the normal Action or LinkAction is ok.
> But,the checkbox could also be as batch box.The checkbox in the first column is visibility only when the table actions contain the BatchAction.

Thanks for clarification. It makes sense.
I added some suggestions in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 25946, 'date': '2018-01-22 15:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25946, 'date': '2018-01-22 15:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > > As a table action ,the normal Action or LinkAction is ok.
 > > But,the checkbox could also be as batch box.The checkbox in the
 > first column is visibility only when the table actions contain the
 > BatchAction.
 > 
 > Thanks for clarification. It makes sense.
 > I added some suggestions in the commit message.

Thanks for your suggestions.Now, the commit message look better，more tall and easier to understand.'}, {'account_id': 14151, 'date': '2018-01-25 02:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

If there is one row, click the checkbox, the row can be also selected.'}, {'account_id': 25946, 'date': '2018-01-25 08:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> If there is one row, click the checkbox, the row can be also
 > selected.

Yes,but what to do with the selected row next,without a BatchAction?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-20 00:32:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Looks good.

I cannot understand what Allen would like to point out. Let's wait for him for a while ."}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

Checkbox in a table assumes BatchAction.
 This commit checks whether at least one BatchAction is
 included as table actions and displays checkboxes
 only when BatchAction is available.

Closes-Bug: #1744742

commit_message:
table: Show checkbox only when there is BatchAction

Checkbox in a table assumes BatchAction.
 This commit checks whether at least one BatchAction is
 included as table actions and displays checkboxes
 only when BatchAction is available.

Change-Id: Ia1cba6c59f5d40f7df7f4b98a9f459a6934cfbb7
Closes-Bug: #1744742

Can you please justify what the other approach of assuming the networks need to be spread doesn't deliver?

Once you update the spec, please try ping my on IRC (johnthetubaguy) if possible, so I will promptly revisit this -2."}, {'account_id': 6509, 'date': '2015-06-09 05:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(6 comments)

John, please take a look at the previous revisions of this change, there were discussions on the topic (i.e. should this feature be implemented only in Nova or implementation should spread across Nova and Neutron).

Generally, it looks like it's not Neutron feature as it's Nova that stores information about the SR-IOV devices and their properties, and does VF allocation."}, {'account_id': 6509, 'date': '2015-06-09 08:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-09 08:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified+1

need to give this a re-read'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-10-13 08:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

as a backlink, its very related to the discussion here, that has been abandoned: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142094/'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2015-10-13 09:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

So for me, there are two things.

1) I am +2 the distributing the nics across PFs when

I am totally +1 that, by default, for all requests where there are multiple nics on the same network. And a soft fallback when there is only one PF available for that network on all hosts (need more details on those edge cases I feel).

2) I am -2 the way users request spreading across multiple PFs

Maybe its better neutron has a concept of a bonded nic, and we use that as the request to spread across PFs, otherwise fail with an error?

If I were doing this, I would be tempted to resurrect the old distributed VIF spec and blueprint for the first half, and get that approved, then slim this one down to depend on the other BP, and tackle this problem for a different angle.

There might be a user case I am missing here, if thats the case, we should add that into the spec.'}, {'account_id': 6509, 'date': '2015-10-13 11:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2015-10-13 11:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2015-10-13 11:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

See my comments on the PS8 - overall this is obviously a useful addition, and we don't want to block useful stuff waiting on "the right thing" that never comes but I feel we are beeing a bit crude here.'}, {'account_id': 6509, 'date': '2015-10-13 11:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

“best effort” allocation as proposed by : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142094/ may not sufficient when the VM definitely requires redundancy. 
Also, there may be 4 ports, 2 for dataplane and two for management/OAM using macvtap, all L3 protected, over two physical interfaces. So Nova must explicitly know about these pairs in order to properly distribute them. 
I think the above two arguments imply that the user has to explicitly define the anti-affinity between the specific ports, which must be imposed by Nova, as proposed by this 182242 BP.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2016-05-17 09:31:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > I'm only putting -1 since I'm fine with the idea of fine control on
 > port allocation, but I'm -2 on any use of Neutron's general tagging
 > facility for this purpose. We need explicit modelling in the API to
 > represent the concepts we want to track.
Ok I agree using tags is not a good idea. 
I will update the spec to use port --binding-profile which is " Custom data to be passed as binding:profile"
so the port create will be 
neutron port-create  --binding-profile='{"network_group":"red"}' private'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2016-09-20 08:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-09-20 08:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Verified+1

I'd like to see some text in here that this is a temporary solution until traits and nested resource providers enable a data-driven (as opposed to nova.conf-driven) way to configure various providers of these nested resources. Plus, see comments on previous patchset with a bunch of typos to fix up.

Basically, this is an NFV-specific use case that assumes equality between the operator and the cloud end-user. In other words, there is just a single user of the Nova API: the MANO or VNFM service and the tribal knowledge of the underlay networking setup and switch configuration is known to this service user ahead of time.

Not cloudy, but this is NFV...

-jay"}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2016-11-09 00:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

(8 comments)

I'm not -1'ing this because of the whole "this is specific to NFV and adds a bunch of complexity" complaint.

I'm -1 on this really because of the networkgroup=X:Y syntax thing. Moshe, is that syntax a Neutron ports API thing? Or is the Neutron API's networkgroup attribute in the binding profile just a free-form string and you are encoding the network and switch grouping identifiers in the X:Y syntax?

If it's *not* a Neutron API thing, would it be possible to have a "networkgroup" and a "switch" attribute in the Neutron port binding profile? That would be cleaner and more explicit IMHO, and would make the pill I have to swallow here a bit easier ;)

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2017-03-09 06:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33:

 > grouping identifiers in the X:Y syntax?

 > If it's *not* a Neutron API thing, would it be possible to have a
 > "networkgroup" and a "switch" attribute in the Neutron port binding
 > profile? That would be cleaner and more explicit IMHO, and would
 > make the pill I have to swallow here a bit easier ;)
 > 
 > Best,
 > 
 > -jay
Hi Jay,
Thanks for reviewing, the binding profile is free-form string so I will update the spec to be "networkgroup" and "switch"'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-03-13 10:48:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33: Code-Review-1

Thanks.

It looks like it could work but I see several downsides.

- Saving meta-information about pci devices in passthrough_whitelist.
  Whitelist sounds like filter I believe it was not aimed to save
  additional info. Although it has physical_network param, possibly
  it's better to update meta about pci in DB through API, especially
  taking into account such info could be changed dynamically
  (connection to specific switch). UI, as was said, is not the best,
  for me API with setting custom tags for pci devices is a more
  appropriate solution.

- Saving request for selecting pci devices in neutron.
  I mean in --binding-profile='{"networkgroup":"*:2"}' we define some
  rules for selecting pci devices and save them in neutron.  If rules
  are changed we need versioning or something similar.  As alternative
  I propose to save selector in nova and save in neutron only
  identificator of this selector.
  --binding-profile='{"pci_device_selector":"not_same_nics_id"}'
  Selector itself could be represented like json structure with rules
  for selecting.

- Labeling pci devices with "aggerated" tag like networkgroup.
  This could narrow us to particular cases and doesn't allow to use
  others. What if we need VFs connected to different switches but on
  one NIC? It could be addressed by saving original data for pci
  devices like: vf1: pf: 1 # I believe we already have such info nic:
  1 # I believe we already have such info switch: 1 vf1: pf: 2 # I
  believe we already have such info nic: 1 # I believe we already have
  such info switch: 2 That allows us to be more flexible and for me,
  it's easier for operators to manage such info.

So I don't stand strong against current proposal rather than want to
get feedback for my concerns.'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-03-14 07:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33:

I need to repeat last part of my message with proper formatting.

- Labeling pci devices with "aggerated" tag like networkgroup.
  This could narrow us to particular cases and doesn't allow to use
  others. What if we need VFs connected to different switches but on
  one NIC? It could be addressed by saving original data for pci
  devices like: 

  vf1: 
     pf: 1 # I believe we already have such info 
     nic:  1 # I believe we already have such info 
     switch: 1 

  vf2: 
     pf: 2 
     nic: 1
     switch: 2 

  That allows us to be more flexible and for me,
  it's easier for operators to manage such info.
  In that case selector coold look like:

  {"unique-tags": ["pf", "switch"],
   "non-unique-tags": ["nic"]}'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-03-14 07:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33:

*aggerated = aggregated'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-14 14:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-14 14:11:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 33:

oops, missed my overall comment.

I much prefer the approach in the previously agreed spec. Its less control, but also less need for the user to make lots of special API calls.

Can't we just distribute things sensible, then find a way to make the build fail if your HA requirements are not met. You really just care they are physically separate, you don't care which one. At least it seems that way in these use cases.

I would just like us to think harder about a more abstract API that solves the same problems in a more user friendly kind of way. This feels too much like a hack."}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-03-22 14:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-03-22 14:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

Hi Sean,
sorry for the late response, was on PTO.

> given that we are wrapping up pike and now heading into queens ...

Agree, we need some solution which helps to select not only SR-IOV VFs
but PCI devices in general. Placement is a great candidate for that,
especially the part of the work is already done.


> i think we need to try and converge this spec with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463526/31 ...

They are very close, some anti-affinity selection mechanism for VFs would cover them both.
I saw your notes in ptg etherpad, will add comments to nested resource providers.

> the tags should not be sotred as part of the whitelist ...

Yeah, ugly approach. One of the requirements is tags should be managed via API
as a state of VFs changes dynamically (for example, port reconnected to different switch).

> i think this is fundementally broken if the network policy ...

Maybe I'm missing something, but all pci_request properties should be preserved,
doesn't matter if it nova config or not.

> using multiple ports like this weill mean that neutron will allocate multiple macs and multiple ips to those ports.

Need to check that case, but patch just changes additional tags for pci requests, all other behavior should be the same.
So if bonding has worked before it would have worked after that change but with different VFs.

Anyway, discussion on PTG would be a great way to move that work on, thanks."}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2017-10-02 21:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

> Anyway, discussion on PTG would be a great way to move that work
 > on, thanks.

Did that discussion happen?

This is a sensible feature request (details aside) particularly when associated with the other spec, and has maybe been outstanding for a *little* too long...'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2017-10-02 22:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-10-02 23:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-10-03 16:27:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 35: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Nested RPs won't have all the functionality you would need to implement this in placement in the Queens time frame.

I have concerns about further overloading the whitelist.  Though it'll (probably) be going away, at least in its current form, in the next few releases, so maybe meh.

I'm also concerned about the end-user syntax that's in play here.  See concerns inline."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This is targeted to pike and we're now in rocky, and this hasn't been updated in a long time so I'm going to abandon it. If you wish to pursue it, please restore, re-propose for rocky and address reviewer feedback."}]

subject: Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible
messages:
[{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-19 22:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-03-03 17:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7226, 'date': '2018-03-05 19:05:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-05 21:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-05 22:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7226, 'date': '2018-03-11 01:06:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

First 2 points were addressed and now the code looks much better. However, I'm still not convinced on exception handling. Imagine that some existing expression does work with test data but fails in production on different data because it had ZeroDivisionError in aggregator function. However what user is going to get in this situation is FunctionNotFoundException. Here the problem is not with the syntax but with the dataset. The syntax is fine and yet you get 1) inconsistent function behavior on different data 2) user gets what looks like syntax error for the valid syntax 3) the root cause (division by zero in this example) get lost"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-26 17:27:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> The syntax is fine and yet you get 1) inconsistent function behavior on different data 2) user gets what looks like syntax error for the valid syntax

I don't think it's possible to ever say the old syntax is 'fine'. AFAICT it's inevitable that there will be some combinations of data and expression that could be interpreted as the user intending either old or new syntax, and we must always interpret it as new syntax in those cases.

The goal here is to make sure that 99% of stuff that was already working with 1.1.1 should continue to work if nobody touches it. If we encounter a case where it would fail even on 1.1.1 and the user has to go debug/modify their expression, the very first thing we want them to do is convert to the new syntax. My hope is that they'd see the syntax error, look up the correct syntax, convert it, and would then see the underlying error and fix that too.

The alternative (i.e. not re-raising the original error) means that somebody using the new, documented, completely valid syntax could encounter an error in their data, and instead of seeing an error message corresponding to the actual cause, they see one that corresponds to whatever weird error you'd get if you interpreted the expression as having the old syntax.

I agree it's going to be somewhat confusing for people using the old syntax, but that seems like a small price to pay for never ever confusing the people who are doing it right."}, {'account_id': 7226, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-19 22:10:43.000000000', 'message': 'Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible

The behaviour of the groupBy() function was fixed in 1.1.2 by
3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the
key and the list of values (and expecting both the key and the
aggregated value to be returned). This fix was incompatible with
existing expressions that used the aggregator argument to groupBy().

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see
if something plausible gets returned. If not, re-raise the original error.
This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent
with the correct definition of the function.

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032
'}, {'created': '2018-03-05 22:33:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible

3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see

This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032
'}]
commit_message:
Make changes to groupBy() backward-compatible

The behaviour of the groupBy() function was fixed in 1.1.2 by
3fb91784018de335440b01b3b069fe45dc53e025 to pass only the list of values
to be aggregated to the aggregator function, instead of passing both the
key and the list of values (and expecting both the key and the
aggregated value to be returned). This fix was incompatible with
existing expressions that used the aggregator argument to groupBy().

In the event of an error, fall back trying the previous syntax and see
if something plausible gets returned. If not, re-raise the original error.
This should mean that pre-existing expressions will continue to work,
while most outright bogus expressions should fail in a manner consistent
with the correct definition of the function.

Change-Id: Ic6c54be4ed99003fe56cf1a5329f3f1d84fd43c8
Closes-Bug: #1750032

[{'created': '2018-03-21 14:11:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix UpdateLRouterPortCommand to work with OVS 2.8

The UpdateLRouterPortCommand was broken when used with OVS <= 2.8 due
to the ipv6_ra_configs column not existing in the OVNDB schema.

This patch is adding a check on that command to ignore that column if
it's not present. A TODO was left as a comment so we don't forget to
remove this check once the support for older OVS versions are dropped.

Change-Id: I1ce87173731146e3f0078df99b7ba56f44b14497
Closes-Bug: #757438

commit_message:
Fix UpdateLRouterPortCommand to work with OVS 2.8

The UpdateLRouterPortCommand was broken when used with OVS <= 2.8 due
to the ipv6_ra_configs column not existing in the OVNDB schema.

This patch is adding a check on that command to ignore that column if
it's not present. A TODO was left as a comment so we don't forget to
remove this check once the support for older OVS versions are dropped.

Change-Id: I1ce87173731146e3f0078df99b7ba56f44b14497
Closes-Bug: #1757438

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary configuration

If none are specified, a default set is used.
The default set is equal to --config-file in here.
So I think --config-file is unnecessary

Change-Id: I5c629b10c1e715f277e0455d6809de1fd43c9181

commit_message:
Update and replace http with https for doc links in heat-templates

1) Update doc links according to OpenStack document migration
2) Use https instead of http for docs links

Change-Id: Id87e91d1f95bcb94c31125c467abab17242cb36f

commit_message:
Load networks and security groups in parallel

We need both networks and security groups info on the port details page.
To speedup page loading we loads this data in parallel using futurist

commit_message:
Dell EMC PS: Fix the driver path

The Dell EMC PS driver's path
cinder.volume.drivers.eqlx.DellEQLSanISCSIDriver is deprecated,
update to new path
cinder.volume.drivers.dell_emc.ps.PSSeriesISCSIDriver

Closes Bug: #1758133

Change-Id: Ia676610fc22da31202133497b7ed0fae66e7ac1c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 13:00:06.000000000', 'message': 'Have run_tests clone the test repo

Current run_tests.sh executes another script (tests-repo-clone.sh)
to clone the tests repo. That script therefore has to be replicated
out to all the other repositories too.

In order to try to reduce the footprint of things that need to be
replicated out to the repositories, we fold the tests repo clone
into run_tests.sh and move the clone of the previous tests repo
into the common test script. We also remove the conditional for
the previous test repo clone as it does no harm to always have it.

To reduce the maintenance when creating new branches, we key the
branch to be cloned by run_tests.sh to the content in the .gitreview
file. This way as soon as a branch is created and that file is
updated, the right branch is cloned and the system becomes self
maintaining.

Change-Id: I9f26f4f438715ce6361cc9960f58f2d256c5a839
'}, {'created': '2018-03-26 13:05:04.000000000', 'message': 'Have run_tests clone the test repo

into run_tests.sh and move the clone of the previous tests repo
into the common test script. We also remove the conditional for

branch to be cloned by run_tests.sh to the content in the .gitreview
file. This way as soon as a branch is created and that file is
updated, the right branch is cloned and the system becomes self
maintaining.

Some extra comments are added to explain the purpose of variables/
commands and the install_pkg_deps function is changed to just be
in line script as the function is no re-used anywhere else.

Change-Id: I9f26f4f438715ce6361cc9960f58f2d256c5a839

commit_message:
Have run_tests clone the test repo

Current run_tests.sh executes another script (tests-repo-clone.sh)
to clone the tests repo. That script therefore has to be replicated
out to all the other repositories too.

In order to try to reduce the footprint of things that need to be
replicated out to the repositories, we fold the tests repo clone
into run_tests.sh and move the clone of the previous tests repo
into the common test script. We also remove the conditional for
the previous test repo clone as it does no harm to always have it.

To reduce the maintenance when creating new branches, we key the
branch to be cloned by run_tests.sh to the content in the .gitreview
file. This way as soon as a branch is created and that file is
updated, the right branch is cloned and the system becomes self
maintaining.

Some extra comments are added to explain the purpose of variables/
commands and the install_pkg_deps function is changed to just be
in line script as the function is no re-used anywhere else.

We change the set vars in the common script to add x and remove v
to reduce the output verbosity and only output the useful stuff.

Finally, the linters job definition is changed so that it uses
run_tests.sh to execute the lint tests. This simplifies the job
definition and also ensures that zuul runs tests in the same way
that humans do.

Change-Id: I9f26f4f438715ce6361cc9960f58f2d256c5a839

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I123055f6eb0a653803ac2b574ea6c87bee707256
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Create ovs temp directories when using ovs

This change creates a tmpfiles file and related directories when using
any "ovs" based plugin.

Change-Id: I616880bc6883eacb8393bbcaabaccccdd2665200
Closes-Bug: #1754144
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Move placement test cases from db to placement

A set of placement functional test is in db layer and we plan to move
placement out of nova, better to move this file to
functional/api/openstack/placement

partial implement blueprint placement-extract

Change-Id: Ie25ed974a19d8fe7bc367e2e0593646a620a49e9

oslo service replaced by cotyledon.
Motivation:
Oslo service uses eventlet and green threads for timers and threads.
In Vitrage we use real threads and multiprocessing, it seems this 
combination causes unexpected behavior (such as timers not running, 
processes not starting) so the entire solution is very delicate to 
changes.

As part of an ongoing effort (previously, monkeypatching was removed)
this commit solves issues encountered in rpc_collector commit in 
addition it removes unnecessary complications in the application.

Co-Authored-By: Eyal <eyal.bar-ilan@nokia.com>
Change-Id: If33708e128d7aeb420a9aa79f71cfccd2b48dfb3
'}]
commit_message:
refactoring vitrage processes

oslo service replaced by cotyledon.
Motivation:
Oslo service uses eventlet and green threads for timers and threads.
In Vitrage we use real threads and multiprocessing, it seems this 
combination causes unexpected behavior (such as timers not running, 
processes not starting) so the entire solution is very delicate to 
changes.

As part of an ongoing effort (previously, monkeypatching was removed)
this commit solves issues encountered in rpc_collector commit in 
addition it removes unnecessary complications in the application.

Co-Authored-By: Eyal <eyal.bar-ilan@nokia.com>
Change-Id: If33708e128d7aeb420a9aa79f71cfccd2b48dfb3

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I7ec32aefc9caac30f4e93704fc33b9a98cb1c622
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11600, 'name': 'Michał Dulko', 'email': 'mdulko@redhat.com', 'username': 'dulek'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 21041, 'name': 'Yossi Boaron', 'email': 'yossi.boaron.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'yboaron'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}]

[{'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-11 13:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-11 21:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-03-14 14:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-03-14 15:39:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you explain a bit how this performs the edit? The trick is keeping the pool in the spec so LBaaS will get updated by handler?'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-15 10:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Michal - Thanks for your time and effort!

1. You can find the service edit reproduce steps in [1] (look for my comment at bottom of page).

2. Lbaas_spec : stores the configuration
   lbaas_state : stores current Openstack configuration 

Kuryr stores both of them in K8S Endpoint resource annotation.


So, for the edit case    
Lbaas_spec  - stores the new cfg --> new port (listener) value
The update logic in LBaas handler (LoadBalancerHandler.on_present) is simple (should be improved) first remove all unnecessary resources from openstack and then recreate the new resources.
For the deletion of unnecessary LB pool resources current code checks 
wrongly if pool exists in Lbaas_state instead of lbaas_spec.

This patch changes it to check in lbaas_Spec



[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kuryr-kubernetes/+bug/1684096'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-15 10:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-15 10:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-15 16:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-03-19 07:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-03-20 07:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thanks Yossi, it looks good to me. One question though, shouldn't it be better to create a new listener and remove the previous one, instead of creating a new loadbalancer?"}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-20 11:10:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Luis, thanks for reviewing the patch.

So the LB won't be re-created, only the listener, pool and members will be deleted and created.

The LBaaS handler create/delete/update flow's order is as follows:

1.self._sync_lbaas_members
  1.1 self._remove_unused_members
  1.2 self._remove_unused_pools
  1.3 self._remove_unused_listeners
  1.4 self._sync_lbaas_loadbalancer
  1.5 self._add_new_listeners 
  1.6 self._add_new_pools
  1.7 self._add_new_members

So, In this specific case, 
A. The members, pool and the listener will be deleted in steps 1.1, 1.2, 1.3.
B. The listener, pool, members will be created in steps 1.5, 1.6, 1.7"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-03-23 17:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-03-26 14:56:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-27 14:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 985c3879495ff6e7af8bdc71e48f3d3256b9ba4a'}]

commit_message:
Services: Add support for K8S service's port edit use case

Kubernetes supports edit operation for API resources.
This patch extends service handler to support edit operation
of  K8S service's port field.

Change-Id: I286dd8a1383de8eda78637d455e6f8035f178c02
Closes-Bug: 1684096

subject: Apply haproxy vars to haproxy group instead of haproxy_all
messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-27 11:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-03-27 11:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 11:20:00.000000000', 'message': "Apply haproxy vars to haproxy group instead of haproxy_all

Any ansible command loads the group vars/host vars.
If haproxy group isn't properly loaded with hosts, the whole
group_vars/haproxy_all/keepalived.yml will fail to get an index
for any host belonging to the group.

Instead the index should search in the group in which the variable
applies to, to ensure it's always the same kind of group.

In a later commit, we should make sure the index is always done when
group size is bigger than 0.

Change-Id: Id489b3f337ea0db0be0008477c9e3afde3872004
Closes-Bug: #1752932
(cherry picked from commit ca8e8fc90abc08e9080a16d5b9fa3fc5a93c29bb)
"}]
commit_message:
Apply haproxy vars to haproxy group instead of haproxy_all

Any ansible command loads the group vars/host vars.
If haproxy group isn't properly loaded with hosts, the whole
group_vars/haproxy_all/keepalived.yml will fail to get an index
for any host belonging to the group.

Instead the index should search in the group in which the variable
applies to, to ensure it's always the same kind of group.

In a later commit, we should make sure the index is always done when
group size is bigger than 0.

Change-Id: Id489b3f337ea0db0be0008477c9e3afde3872004
Closes-Bug: #1752932
(cherry picked from commit ca8e8fc90abc08e9080a16d5b9fa3fc5a93c29bb)

change because of the use of set theory. This change converts the use of

commit_message:
Retain the ordering when using with MultiStringOp

When using config_template with a MultiStringOp the order was subject to
change because of the use of set theory. This change converts the use of
sets to tuples which allow us to retain the ability to override options
without losing the ordering of keys.

Change-Id: Id0bba86629a33ce74528c0bd51b11183f5315d86
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 662a2805c0dce43a1efec31a85e09056207ec3d2)

Oh boy, well, thanks for the spec, but a few things:

1. The Pike release is closed for new specs:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova/Pike_Release_Schedule

The Queens release will be the next opportunity for new specs.

2. This particular request has been made probably half a dozen times before (ask Chet Burgess about it - cburgess in IRC). There are probably at least 4 blueprints in launchpad right now for this. The response is always the same:

https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/project_scope.html#no-more-api-proxies

You can create a volume with a specific non-default type and bring that to nova to create the server, then nova doesn't need to proxy this all the way through."}, {'account_id': 1523, 'date': '2017-05-23 05:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

1. Yes, I change target release from pike to queens

2. I agree with "nova more API proxies' concept. However, this request is different from others.
Nova already have a boot from volume feature. Many users seem to need this feature a lot and this is not about adding a new feature but making a use it more intelligently.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-05-23 13:50:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

-1 for the same reasons I said back in May, this isn't a new proposal and we've said for years now that we're not going to add this proxy orchestration to nova. You can create the volume with a specific type using the block storage API directly, and then provide that volume ID to nova when creating the instance doing boot from volume. It's the same with SR-IOV ports or other advanced port usage with Neutron."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-27 14:33:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Support volume_type with BDM paramter

Currently when creating a new instance with boot from volume,
user only can choose volume_size.
the volume to be attached as a root is the volume type defined
in default_volume_type of cinder configuration in multi backed
environments. In other words, the user cannot select the root
volume type as the desired volume type.

blueprint support-volume-type-with-bdm-parameter

commit_message:
Add service-protected-server spec

Looks at how to use a service token to create a server locked to the
service, and the user is not allowed to manipulate the server in any
way.

Note - this is still a work in progress.

blueprint service-protected-server

Change-Id: Ib41cb0247c660d4f6b7327da1370e2c3f2974d74

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I1a0941d79d112b6f4fde22885df985e7caaeb2c3
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Id469e90d53d52f13b596b71904604ec073289e88
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[DOCS] Update references for nspawn type containers

Now that the ability to use nspawn type containers has merged this patch
updates the deployer and reference documentation to cover the new
options.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 13:51:47.000000000', 'message': "Add missing custom label declaration for limestone nodepool config

In a6dd6ff720b191eff0b0236f70e3b93c6b8d7f3f we changed the labels in
the provider configuration but we also need to add them here.

There's no need to set a min-ready key for these.

Change-Id: Ib653a493176da5bc64bc4587a2be3d3d8c4e3807
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing custom label declaration for limestone nodepool config

In a6dd6ff720b191eff0b0236f70e3b93c6b8d7f3f we changed the labels in
the provider configuration but we also need to add them here.

There's no need to set a min-ready key for these.

Change-Id: Ib653a493176da5bc64bc4587a2be3d3d8c4e3807

commit_message:
Honor {{role.name}}ExtraConfig with deprecated params

{{role.name}}ExtraConfig was previously ignored if the role used
deprecated params in roles_data.yaml. This was due to the usage of
server_resource_name in the ExtraConfig resource, where
service_resource_name also defaulted to
deprecated_service_resource_name. So, the new {{role.name}}ExtraConfig
was never actually used.

Change-Id: I83e57317e2c56260957be90c66290a41a926835a
Closes-Bug: #1758343

messages: [{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-03-26 23:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-03-27 00:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-27 03:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-27 03:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-27 03:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27552, 'date': '2018-03-27 03:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit e06b95f6676959a694fdbce2293dd747fcf23730'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 23:45:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
'}, {'created': '2018-03-27 03:41:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health manager edge case with zombie amphora

There is a edge case where amphora may have been deleted, marked deleted in
our database, but still be running in nova. One example is an instance stuck
in nova "deleting" status. These can still report health heartbeats, but
we will see them as failed as they are reporting load balancing configuration
that we do not have a record for. This will lead to a failover to repair the
amphora, which will re-attempt the delete and reset the amphora health record.
Which can lead to another failover attempt.

This patch will log and leave the amphora as "busy" if a failover is attempted
on an amphora we show as "DELETED". This will prevent repeated failover
attempts on "DELETED" amphora that are still alive in the compute system.

It also fixes a mis-named mock object in a failover test.

Change-Id: I3397ffacf8e08964ecd4b47f2353542b6bc57645

commit_message:
Strip the trailing '.' from the fqdn dns record stored in OVN NB DB

Presently the dns fqdn record for a port is stored with trailing '.'
character. Eg. vm1.ovn.test."="10.0.0.4"

Fix this to store it as "vm1.ovn.test"="10.0.0.4"

Closes-bug: #1757074
Change-Id: I8cdc48065acdac9dcc5955c223824714ecd92437

commit_message:
Omit default_schedule_zone if its not configured

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/551324
- https://review.openstack.org/554925

There are cases where the default AZ is not called 'nova' in
a single AZ environment.  This patch adds the default behavior
of Nova by leaving it empty if it's not used.

For deployers that are using it, it will be added so this
should not break them.

Change-Id: Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c

(6 comments)

This looks good, and I'm glad that Nova is acting on this. We need *all* projects to adopt similar rules in order to get the benefits, so the main question I have is about how to co-ordinate this change across OpenStack. There's a couple of things that suggest it hasn't been completely thought through yet how to apply equivalent rules across all projects, and also I'm sure operators would appreciate  doing a global addition of roles to users just once instead of over multiple upgrade cycles as projects switch over individually."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-15 20:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified-1

(5 comments)

@Zane thanks for taking a look.

My hope, upgrade wise, is to have zero deployer impact to start with, until we have more projects using this new model.

My current plan is to prove its possible in Nova, allowing folks who know what they are doing, to more easily do the right thing. Once thats in place we can look at making adopting this pattern a TC goal, or similar.

Hopefully that gives a bit more context on where I am thinking we go with this one.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-16 11:25:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-16 12:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-16 12:51:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified+1

- gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/72/427872/17/check/gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/d948951/ : SUCCESS in 3m 31s'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2017-04-04 02:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

Defining Roles is not a Nova decision to make in a vacuum.  If Nova creates rol.es, and the other systems do not update policy, you will open up a large secruity hole:  any one with any role, even limited ones, will be able to perform operations on a server that only performs the role checks.

please see:  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391624/  as the right way to solve this problem.

Or, you could keep on this course and ruin it for everyone.  Please choose wisely.

BTW, there was an earlier proposal along these lines made at the cross-project spec level that dolphm and jamielennox lead up.  If was held up on the enforcement issues I raised above, but should match up cleanly.  Essentially.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-04-04 13:53:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

@adam, I remember you mentioning this before, but I still don't understand the enforcement issue you are talking about.

These are all Nova specific roles. Agreed if you are a project member because you have a role, that means different things in other services.

Just tying to understand what was missed at the PTG where we agreed this approach with the keystone folks who were present there."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-04-04 13:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

I am also curious how this relates to the iroinc approach that has already been merged that is along similar lines:

PLease abandon this and follow up with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245629/8  instead'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-04-12 13:03:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Workflow-1

Need to gain consensus on the approach for delegation. I still don't understand the object to this approach."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2017-05-05 17:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+1

> Defining Roles is not a Nova decision to make in a vacuum.  If Nova creates roles, and the other systems do not update policy, you will open up a large secruity hole:  any one with any role, even limited ones, will be able to perform operations on a server that only performs the role checks.

IIUC I don't think it's strictly accurate to say that this *opens* a security hole as such if other projects don't modify their policy. That implies that it'd be worse than the current situation, 

It's certainly true that there are no *benefits* to be had (i.e. locking down security more tightly) until all projects have updated their policy. I guess if the existence of these roles led people to believe they were more tightly locked down before that was actually the case, then they could inadvertently introduce security holes. I expect this is what you meant. John updated the spec after your comment to make this clear in the 'Security Impact' section.

If I'm misunderstanding, please let me know.

> please see:  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391624/  as the right way to solve this problem.

I think I understand where you're coming from here, because in that spec you wrote that "Any approach which requires changes to every project has little to no chance of succeeding." It's here that we disagree; the point of this is absolutely to roll out equivalent changes to every project in the following development cycle, and the project-wide goals initiative makes that feasible. It's just that somebody has to be first.

That's not to say the Keystone spec isn't valuable - it is, but that looks like a longer-term, gold-plated solution whereas this path can provide a lot of value, potentially in a shorter time frame.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:38:47.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This would need to be updated for Rocky at this point, and let's see how the system scope token stuff works out first."}]

commit_message:
Add additional-default-policy-roles spec

Currently we only really have a global admin or not global admin in the
default policy file. This builds on the previous work of
policy-remove-scope-checks and looks at deciding if each API is either a
read API, a write API or an admin API.

blueprint additional-default-policy-roles

Change-Id: Ib4cc7141d900881a7dc20842eb5d68eb90521fdd

"}, {'created': '2018-03-23 18:20:28.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Support for forbidden traits in placement

This is a spike which provides support for forbidden traits in the
placement API. Where the 'required' param is used in either GET
/resource_providers or GET /allocation_candidates if a trait is prefixed
with '!' then that trait should not show up in the providers used in the
results.

This code will be broken up into multiple patches as it matures. Working
in a lump was easier because I was coming at it from gabbi tests.

In /allocation_candidates this does not currently work with nested
resource providers. When nested does work, there will need to be
some adjustments and discussions about what forbidden should mean with
regard to the tree of resources.

RequestGroup parsing is only used by /allocation_candidates, not
/resource_providers. There is conflict detection (required and forbidden
of the same trait in the same group is an error).

Some duplicate code for '_get_provider_ids_having_any_trait' and
'_all_traits' has been combined to one method that does 'all' if an
optional paramter is True (default to True).

Change-Id: I6501fca352aa3faac75e66c66c7505e2c1f66d5e
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Support for forbidden traits in placement

This is a spike which provides support for forbidden traits in the
placement API. Where the 'required' param is used in either GET
/resource_providers or GET /allocation_candidates if a trait is prefixed
with '!' then that trait should not show up in the providers used in the
results.

This code will be broken up into multiple patches as it matures. Working
in a lump was easier because I was coming at it from gabbi tests.

In /allocation_candidates this does not currently work with nested
resource providers. When nested does work, there will need to be
some adjustments and discussions about what forbidden should mean with
regard to the tree of resources.

RequestGroup parsing is only used by /allocation_candidates, not
/resource_providers. There is conflict detection (required and forbidden
of the same trait in the same group is an error).

Some duplicate code for '_get_provider_ids_having_any_trait' and
'_all_traits' has been combined to one method that does 'all' if an
optional paramter is True (default to True).

Todo:

* non-gabbi functional tests
* microversion handling and documentation
* api-ref update

blueprint placement-forbidden-traits

Change-Id: I6501fca352aa3faac75e66c66c7505e2c1f66d5e

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Id195a44f356607f68dd88246f09ae0a4f46ca64a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Refactor backup and restore docs

This patch will refactor the current documentation
we have to run an Undercloud backup and restore and
will provide new documentation for the Overcloud control
plane backup and restore.

Change-Id: I8a8bbabed007fef5cbe9290db370b65464908475

add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

subject: Fix kube token create with string join error
messages:
[{'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-27 04:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-03-27 05:16:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is more likely supposed to be
> token = '%s.%s' % (token_id, token_secret)

Which would generate a token like this
> jisrfk e066cnixal89ksm3

Also, could we add a basic test for this?"}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-03-27 05:17:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This is more likely supposed to be
 > > token = '%s.%s' % (token_id, token_secret)
 > 
 > Which would generate a token like this
 > > jisrfk e066cnixal89ksm3
 > 
 > Also, could we add a basic test for this?

* jisrfk.e066cnixal89ksm3"}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Why this change?

According to https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/setup-tools/kubeadm/kubeadm-token/

The token format is  “[a-z0-9]{6}.[a-z0-9]{16}”'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:18:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Why this change?
 > 
 > According to https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/setup-tools/kubeadm/kubeadm-token/
 > 
 > The token format is  “[a-z0-9]{6}.[a-z0-9]{16}”

The code is currently broken.
> TypeError: join() takes exactly one argument (2 given)

We should probably open a bug report for this and associate it with this, and at least write a regression test.

Like I mentioned above, it should be something like this.
> token = '%s.%s' % (token_id, token_secret)"}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Qiming It's join format error."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-27 12:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 04:06:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix kube token create error

Change-Id: Ia8414037a1291415272b591a9a2e5a7fa5347e41
'}, {'created': '2018-03-27 06:28:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix kube token create with string join error

This patch fix token format error, string join error,
Example:
   token_id = 'ufxq7o'
   token_secret = 'yz7till9p24zb0dj'
   token = '.'.join([token_id, token_secret])
The token value is 'ufxq7o.yz7till9p24zb0dj'

Change-Id: Ia8414037a1291415272b591a9a2e5a7fa5347e41
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kube token create with string join error

This patch fix token format error, string join error,
Example:
   token_id = 'ufxq7o'
   token_secret = 'yz7till9p24zb0dj'
   token = '.'.join([token_id, token_secret])
The token value is 'ufxq7o.yz7till9p24zb0dj'

Change-Id: Ia8414037a1291415272b591a9a2e5a7fa5347e41

commit_message:
Consume ceph-container project's new style of tags

The ceph-container project is moving to a new style of tags for
Ceph. Update scenario001/004 to pull Ceph container images using
the new tags.

Change-Id: I2a6a7c5fb5148e951f85850c09be7cbb59fce0f8
(cherry picked from commit 09ff488f0df36df321e5d711f8b49c343013f12d)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Idf28fdf830bf9524df8fbeb684658719bccf4f0a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Add healthcheck script for libvirtd

This patch adds script for docker health check of nova-libvirt container.
The script checks API service using virsh.

commit_message:
Prevent overwriting of last_error on cleaning failures

This changes moves the call to tear_down_cleaning to before we set
the last_error and maintenance_reason fields. Thus we avoid
overwriting last_error by e.g. power actions.

Related-Bug: #1588901
Change-Id: Ia448431a2922ea6f7adc27065dbcab1ba8358daa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 07:04:05.000000000', 'message': 'HAProxy: expose stats socket in HA containerized deployment

Configure haproxy bundle to bind mount /var/lib/haproxy from the
host, in order to expose the stats socket.

Change-Id: Ib833ebe16fcc1356c9e0fc23a7eebe9c4b970c55
'}]
commit_message:
HAProxy: expose stats socket in HA containerized deployment

Configure haproxy bundle to bind mount /var/lib/haproxy from the
host, in order to expose the stats socket.

Change-Id: Ib833ebe16fcc1356c9e0fc23a7eebe9c4b970c55

commit_message:
Cleanup old MariaDB cruft from override file

Kolla is switching to MariaDB package provided by RDO instead of
mariadb.org. We do not need to overwrite the package names in our
overrides file anymore.

Change-Id: Iabaa9f0d2b9a8622a01a2d434311c44aac4d0d70
Depends-On: I071362fc1b8d60199a77e2fe0475d2b4c3b5341b

commit_message:
Cleanup swift/common/middleware/s3api/test dir

The scripts in the dir was used to setup functional tests
but they will be never used in swift upstream so let's cleanup
those scripts.

The configs for ceph-s3-test would be useful to make non-voting
gate in the swift upstream, this patch moves them into doc/s3api/conf
dir that is not included source code tree, anyway.

Change-Id: I608ed3a620478bc4ab2fdd8901ea987e356298c9

subject: Use endpoint rather than url in clouds.yaml with no keystone
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-03-24 10:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-26 17:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-27 11:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-24 10:39:30.000000000', 'message': 'Use endpoint rather than url in clouds.yaml with no keystone

When keystone is not in use, the clouds.yaml file generated by bifrost
uses an auth_type of "none". This does not appear to work, and results
in the following error (even with OS_CLOUD=bifrost):

Missing parameter(s):
Set a cloud-name with --os-cloud or OS_CLOUD

This change modifies the "url" parameter to be "endpoint", which works
correctly.

Change-Id: I9b84739dcb90b6482b332676244c68642042dfd4
Closes-Bug: #1754070
(cherry picked from commit e1a167a3bbc6b2f84b040f54ae0ef9b22d252eb4)
'}]
commit_message:
Use endpoint rather than url in clouds.yaml with no keystone

When keystone is not in use, the clouds.yaml file generated by bifrost
uses an auth_type of "none". This does not appear to work, and results
in the following error (even with OS_CLOUD=bifrost):

Missing parameter(s):
Set a cloud-name with --os-cloud or OS_CLOUD

This change modifies the "url" parameter to be "endpoint", which works
correctly.

Change-Id: I9b84739dcb90b6482b332676244c68642042dfd4
Closes-Bug: #1754070
(cherry picked from commit e1a167a3bbc6b2f84b040f54ae0ef9b22d252eb4)

commit_message:
Remove extra ssh args passed to ansible

These are already set in the default ansible configuration file that is
generated with write_default_ansible_cfg() prior to running ansible,
and are thus redundant.

Change-Id: Ie756280c8b58354bef43cf92df1efb960ae4801d

commit_message:
Remove pbr warnerrors in favor of sphinx check

This change removes the now unused "warnerrors" setting, which is
replaced by "warning-is-error" in sphinx releases >= 1.5 [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113085.html

Change-Id: I567e61fa5aaa3101135684ff3d8c1370d8acb20b

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-k8s-rabbitmq

Add the role to deploy RabbitMQ under the tripleo group.  These roles will
be used to deploy these services on Kubernetes respectively.

Change-Id: I101688697f66ea6cc8acfe2d55173bb5e87994b6
Needed-by: I7fc273782e2e64cebcb3d49960b72c817ee9d4d5

Add fixtures-git project

Add project to contain test code spun out from git-upstream as a fixture
to allow other projects to reuse.

commit_message:
Fix bashate "local hides exit status" warnings

Promote "local hides exit status" (E042) to error and fix issues found
(this is inline with what we do in devstack).

Change-Id: Idd784af066db80bb67792da3dd0aa0ae4c8475db

commit_message:
Create the ara-plugins project

This follows up on the change to create the ara-web project [1] and the
split of the ARA components in the upcoming release.

We are splitting the components in order to allow indenpendant
installation and deployment for each component.

The ara-plugins project will contain the plugins, modules and callbacks
for ARA.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528358/

Change-Id: I2d345414d16d4f08f9d4570a92f24b7a43203e66

commit_message:
Create the ara-clients project

This follows up on the change to create the ara-web project [1] and the
split of the ARA components in the upcoming release.

We are splitting the components in order to allow indenpendant
installation and deployment for each component.

The ara-clients project will contain the client interfaces, modules
and libraries for ARA.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528358/

Change-Id: Ia7a413e596bc4291cde1e342caf1d1c2c7b719fe

commit_message:
Create the ara-server project

This follows up on the change to create the ara-web project [1] and the
split of the ARA components in the upcoming release.

We are splitting the components in order to allow indenpendant
installation and deployment for each component.

The ara-server project will contain the backend/model and API for ARA.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528358/

Change-Id: I9d40e00588b03da6aca55e1ad1c7009635f3e4ec

commit_message:
Correctly set NeutronMl2PluginBase for OVN scenario

OVN configuration was not done when deployed with
scenario007 as default for NeutronMl2PluginBase was
used which is neutron-plugin-ml2.yaml. This patch
fixes this to use neutron-plugin-ml2-ovn.yaml which
correctly configures neutron for ovn metadata.

Change-Id: I7cadd0567951b85c1ba69d4b4843ee29b67e7a11
Closes-Bug: #1757134

commit_message:
Add tripleo-upgrade specific parameters.

In order to run some of the needed
tripleo-upgrade tasks, we need to set
tripleo_ci variable, as the role is being
used for downstream as well as upstream
testing and this is the flag to run specific
TripleO CI tasks.

Change-Id: I15530dce10d3e2bd08f69e6d71ca0ba95a27b30c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 09:50:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix minor updates for deployed server environments

We were getting permission denied errors in CI for minor
update. Nowadays we should be using tripleo-admin user when connecting
to overcloud via ssh. Heat-admin works only when the servers were
deployed as part of the overcloud Heat stack.

Change-Id: I1ec66886d6d61ccf528e5e27872cf68c7a603727
Closes-Bug: #1757090
'}]
commit_message:
Fix minor updates for deployed server environments

We were getting permission denied errors in CI for minor
update. Nowadays we should be using tripleo-admin user when connecting
to overcloud via ssh. Heat-admin works only when the servers were
deployed as part of the overcloud Heat stack.

Change-Id: I1ec66886d6d61ccf528e5e27872cf68c7a603727
Closes-Bug: #1757090

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is currently
unused, we can set the functional test to
non-voting in order to allow general pattern
changes to be implemented without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556279
Change-Id: I3f795e59f1b58862f2f196b2ac06d9891c3a17fa
(cherry picked from commit 00e1b9575e3786cec3f62676e9c6d270cf116398)

commit_message:
Add sphinx built manpages if they exist

Rather than statically listing manpages in the setup.cfg file which
would break if sphinx hasn't run at setup.py sdist time, look to see if
any exist in the sphinx build-dir location, and if so assume that the
user wants to install them. Because they almost certainly do.

Change-Id: Ia57133fdfa5c7b2a3400bbb986beb1029f97b196

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic70628d7ac94d108e0b4e603ab6e9efd1d81ea98

rarely passes and the repo itself is only

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Change-Id: I53d0840ab61f5d63620875dc0ffdce16ed97190e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556281

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 2b51da5f0a3a1c088c5e8c27a2907e781ac6a131)

commit_message:
add python version number to db file

this way we can run detox instead of tox
and it will make tox run faster on our dev machines

Change-Id: I9ff327edb1b1d0842ba14fe90784321c4ee27da0

commit_message:
Fix to use "." to source script files

Adhering to coding conventions. Refer to ``Code conventions`` at
https://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/ for details.

Closes-Bug: #1714397
Change-Id: Ic8ddb0b7bd343fe3d548a1a26940b76ef587922c

subject: Make unstable functional test non-voting
messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-26 10:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ocata as commit a0f2fb5bd7b7563f116684436b8459d11ad1cb1e'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-26 11:24:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I do not quite feel comfortable with that to be honest. Disabling voting just masks the problem I believe. If the role doesn't get enough love to have working functional tests then maybe it should be deprecated to raise awareness."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-26 11:29:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Markos I agree, but until there is more active maintenance on the role it just gets further and further behind on common things we try to fix/improve across all roles. The tech debt grows.

Of course another option is to formally deprecate the role and retire it. I'm kinda OK with that, but many of the roles in this state receive fixes sometimes in sporadic bursts from people who actually want to use them, so I don't necessarily think retiring it is the best option.

This, to me, is a middle ground. We can still push patches to keep the role current in terms of patterns and the proposal bot updates still happen and merge, but the function of the role itself is left to whoever wants to use it."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-27 09:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

OK fair enough'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-27 10:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Change-Id: I53d0840ab61f5d63620875dc0ffdce16ed97190e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556280

[{'created': '2018-03-12 17:39:34.000000000', 'message': "builddoc: Treat '[pbr] autodoc_tree_excludes' as a multi-line opt

We were treating this a single line, comma- or space-delimited option.
This was incorrect and was causing issues for projects like neutron-lib
when Sphinx 1.7, which switches from optparse to the stricter argparse
was used. In addition, this project was including comments in the
multi-line opt. These were being passed through but Sphinx < 1.7 was
simply ignoring them. These are now filtered out.

Change-Id: I177edf0f44714175da220cf3a960b8f23aa4ab09
Closes-Bug: #1753082

commit_message:
builddoc: Treat '[pbr] autodoc_tree_excludes' as a multi-line opt

We were treating this a single line, comma- or space-delimited option.
This was incorrect and was causing issues for projects like neutron-lib
when Sphinx 1.7, which switches from optparse to the stricter argparse
was used. In addition, this project was including comments in the
multi-line opt. These were being passed through but Sphinx < 1.7 was
simply ignoring them. These are now filtered out.

Change-Id: I177edf0f44714175da220cf3a960b8f23aa4ab09
Closes-Bug: #1753082

commit_message:
Don't failover amphora with LB in PENDING_*

This patch updates the health manager to update the amphora_health timestamp
even if the listener count does not match if the load balancer is in PENDING_*
provisioning status. This will stop failovers for occuring on load balancers
being updated or deleted.

Change-Id: I7d483d764bd841c6977afa0bcf3227e02c573b91
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Include connectivity check prepare scripts during FFU

This change includes the connectivity check prepare scripts step
during FFU and it moves the tasks covering it to the
common dir and assigns specific tags for each FFU stage. In
addition it saves the floating IP address to a file so it can be
used in stages where Neutron API is not available.

Change-Id: I9d61f6eaa105e9eb2854eb749f570c395de155fe
(cherry picked from commit 55ff3f72cdf8d9acc15c22a6ee72a215fc324fcc)

commit_message:
Revert "Bump max-servers limestone nodepool provider to 10"

There are some issues with name resolution, probably related to the lack of public ipv4 addresses, need further investigation.

This reverts commit 2a0d9faadba0401d30c1f6b65c0cd0a28517767b.

Change-Id: I12bc4adf739092b811ca694c535d3492fcf70dc9

Any ansible command loads the group vars/host vars.
If haproxy group isn't properly loaded with hosts, the whole
group_vars/keepalived.yml will fail to get an index for any
host belonging to the group.

Instead the index should search in the group in which the variable
applies to, to ensure it's always the same kind of group.

TODO: On top of that we should make sure the index is always done when
group size is bigger than 0.

commit_message:
Apply haproxy vars to haproxy group instead of haproxy_all

Any ansible command loads the group vars/host vars.
If haproxy group isn't properly loaded with hosts, the whole
group_vars/haproxy_all/keepalived.yml will fail to get an index
for any host belonging to the group.

Instead the index should search in the group in which the variable
applies to, to ensure it's always the same kind of group.

In a later commit, we should make sure the index is always done when
group size is bigger than 0.

Change-Id: Id489b3f337ea0db0be0008477c9e3afde3872004
Closes-Bug: #1752932

bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2cafc4f53f65c5f0c3fd18eff6600cca59b585ac

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I2cafc4f53f65c5f0c3fd18eff6600cca59b585ac
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Add zuulv3 jobs to check and gate pipelines

This patch set adds functional and scenario jobs
to the watcher-tempest-plugin repo.

Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more detials information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-07-12 15:28:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug nova does not clean-up the second ephemeral disk when this one isn't any more used by instances

Currently, the backing file for the second ephemeral disk is never deleted on the hypervisor.
After some instance create/delete period, the hypervisor local storage capacities are reduced.
In order to solve this problem, an update is made in image cache management :
- the backing file is added in the list of base images
- if it's used by some instance, then it's added in the list of backing images
- if remove_unused_base_images = True, and if it's not included in list of backing images, then it's deleted.

Change-Id: I9b99f0376c652b36d9ed4f2849aaf8b0eeb6b59d
Closes-Bug: 1602193

commit_message:
Clean up second ephemeral disk

Currently, the backing file for the second ephemeral disk
is never deleted on the hypervisor, even when this one isn't
any more used by instances. After some instance
create/delete period, the hypervisor local storage capacities
are reduced.

In order to solve this problem, an update is made in image
cache management :
- the backing file is added in the list of base images
- if it's used by some instance, then it's added in the list
of backing images
- if remove_unused_base_images = True, and if it's not included
in list of backing images, then it's deleted.

Change-Id: I9b99f0376c652b36d9ed4f2849aaf8b0eeb6b59d
Closes-Bug: 1602193

commit_message:
Add img_linked_clone support in libvirt

There is a glance image property named 'img_linked_clone', used to
control the association of image and instance, but it can not use
in libvirt. If set img_linked_clone=False, means flatten the image
after instance created, the association of image and instance will
be broken, image and instance will be independent of each other.

Change-Id: Ib6ef2afbdfc8c3114e5d5faf9736a12d8237deb8
Closes-Bug: #1697391

subject: Allow live migrate paused instance when post copy is enabled

commit_message:
Allow live migrate paused instance when post copy is enabled

Live migration of paused instance fails when VIR_MIGRATE_POSTCOPY
flag is set. In this patch, the flag is unset to permit live migration
of paused instance.

Change-Id: Ib5cbc948cb953e35a22bcbb859976f0afddcb662
Closes-Bug: #1671011
